Press Gazetted reported in 2006 that phone-hacking, or`` screwing'' as it was known, was rife across Fleet Street before the Goodman and Mulcaire arrests. Gossip email newsletter Popbitch asked back in 2001: `` Which newspaper showbiz desk has a trick for getting stories out of celebs' mobile phones?( Two hacks simultaneously call a celeb's mobile. One gets the answerphone, and types in 9, followed by 3333. If the hapless celeb hasn't changed the default access code, the hack gets their messages, and can even delete them afterwards to cover their tracks).
